@graph.name: Physiotherapy for Shoulder Dislocation: Recovery and Recurrence Prevention
@graph.description: Rehabilitation after shoulder dislocation: 3-phase protocol to prevent recurrence (90% in <20 years). Evidence-based program. 5 clinics Greater Montreal.

@graph.name: Physiotherapy for Shoulder Dislocation
@graph.description: Physiotherapy rehabilitation treatment for shoulder dislocation including 3-phase protocol: protection and initial recovery (0-4 weeks), strengthening and stabilization (4-8 weeks), re-athleticization and return to activities (8+ weeks). Recurrence prevention (90% in <20 years, 10% in >40 years).
@graph.preparation: Comprehensive initial evaluation including range of motion, muscle strength, stability tests, proprioception and functional assessment. Consultation as soon as medical clearance after reduction and imaging.
@graph.followup: Periodic re-evaluations every 4 weeks to adjust treatment plan. Long-term maintenance program (2-3x/week) after initial rehabilitation to prevent recurrence.
@graph.howPerformed: Progressive 3-phase protocol: Phase 1 (0-4 weeks) passive mobilizations and light isometric contractions, Phase 2 (4-8 weeks) isotonic rotator cuff strengthening and scapular stabilization, Phase 3 (8+ weeks) high-energy exercises and sport-specific re-athleticization.
@graph.expectedPrognosis: Complete recovery in 3 to 6 months on average. Return to non-contact sports possible in 3-4 months, contact sports in 4-6 months if functional criteria met (strength 90%+ compared to uninjured side, stability demonstrated).
contraindication: Early return to at-risk activities during healing
Combined abduction-external rotation positions 8-12 first weeks
Return to sport without functional testing validation
@graph.adverseOutcome: Dislocation recurrence if inadequate rehabilitation (rate 72-100% in <20 years, 70-82% in 20-30 years, 10-15% in >40 years). Risk of chronic instability requiring surgery if program not completed.

seriousAdverseOutcome.name: Chronic shoulder instability
seriousAdverseOutcome.description: Repeated recurrent dislocations causing progressive damage to stabilizing structures (capsule, labrum, ligaments)
